captions.text: MOSFILM

Experimental
Artistic Association
Itís damp.
The air smells like a graveyard.

For six months Iíve been smelling
my own grave.
Hey, Chudra!
Why did you leave our camp?

Gypsies are no longer
what they used to be.
They give away a horse for gold.

Theyíll give away their knife,
and even their soul.

Tell me, Chudra,
who knows more,
the fool or the wise man?
The fool.
The wise man doubts everything.
Then blessed are the fools, Chudra.

Too much knowledge
only brings sorrow.

What would you say to me if this
were to be our last meeting?

Do not love gold,
it will betray you.

Do not love women,
they will betray you.

Freedom is the headiest
wine of all.
Rise always at the break of day.

Remember, the sunset falls
when you donít expect it.
I wish you long life, Zobar.
Let your death come in time.

GYPSIES ARE FOUND
NEAR HEAVEN

Based on stories by
M. GORKY
Svetlana TOMA as Rada
Grigore GRIGORIU as Zobar

Cast:
Siladi ñ Ion Sandri SCUREA

Talimon ñ Pavel ANDREICHENKO
Bubulia ñ Sergiu FINITI

Old Gypsy WomanñLyalya CHORNAYA
Bucha ñ Borislav BRONDUKOV
Rusalina ñ Nelly VOLSHANINOVA

Danilo ñ Vsevolod GAVRILOV
Nur ñ Mikhail SHISHKOV
Aralambi ñ Nikolai VOLSHANINOV

Balint ñ Vassily SIMCHICH
Yulishka ñ Yelena SADOVSKAYA

Gheorghe DIMITRIU
Belash VISHNEVSKY

Alyona BUZYLYOVA
Dumitru MOCANU

Songs Performed by
Nikolai Volshaninov, Rada Volshaninova

Nikolai Zhemchuzhny,
Zhenya Savelyeva
Alyona Buzylyova, Tahir Bobrov

Zinaida Antonova
Dmitri Buzylyov, Lyalya Mihai

Written and Directed by
Emil LOTEANU

Director of Photography
Sergey VRONSKY

Cameraman
Vladimir KROMAS

Production Designer
Felix YASYUKEVICH
Music by Eugene DOGA
Choreography by P. ANDREICHENKO

GYPSIES ARE FOUND
NEAR HEAVEN
Four kings.

To the new, twentieth, century,
gentlemen!

- To your health.
- Thank you.

- Schwabb!
- Yes, Lieutenant?
Can you dance the waltz?
No, I canít, Lieutenant.

Place your right hand
on my left shoulder.
Yes, sir.

- Propertsium.
- Yes, sir?
What will be the 20th century like?

Everything seems to be confused.
The Zodiac signs are contradictory.

The end of the world will come
in 16 years.
Mister Balint!

- What is it?
- Look!

Are you in your right mind?
Couldnít you wait until tomorrow?
I couldnít. Last night I set a trap

to see what the new year
will be like.

I know now that it will be
a magnificent year! Look!
Mister Balint,

on this side of the Carpathians
you wonít find horses like these.
Nor on the other side.
Some light.
Letís have some light.
I donít take government horses.

- What about the others?
- I said, no government property.
Itís up to you, my dear.

Tomorrow weíll take them
to the fair in Seget
and sell them for pure gold.
I take those that arenít the armyís.

Wait. You still havenít paid
for the last ones we brought.

Youíre always at my throat.
Give me some time to breathe.
I wish to do honest business.

Honest business
selling stolen horses?

Iíd like to offer my best wishes
to your honoured guests

and to your family.
May you all live long!
Thank you.

But itís bad luck to start
a new year with old debts.
Letís go.
Excuse us.
You wait here.

- Do you like me?
- Not much.

Come back at Easter
and Iíll pay you the rest.
All right.

Donít be angry. Youíve got
the finest Bessarabian racers.
Theyíre priceless. Farewell!
Get down!
Zobar, to the left!
Surround them!
Donít shoot!

I want them alive!
Capture them alive!
Run for it!
Run for it!
Let them have the horses!

Let them go! To hell with them!
Weíll be caught!
Theyíll hang us!

Come on, come closer!
Come get me! Come on!

Weíll finish up
on the end of a rope.
Hanging high from the oak branches!
Leave the horses, Zobar!

Leave the horses,
letís get across the Tisza!
Shut up and run for it!

You could at least pity the horses,
you Gypsy swine!

The crows will pick out
my violet eyes!
Youíll be hanged!

- You will be hanged yourself!
- We'll hang you by your feet!
Youíll have to catch me first!
Now run for it! Quick!
Weíll go this way!
Son of a bitch!
After them!
This is the end of a Gypsy boy!
Who are you?
MyÖ name isÖ
Zobar.
And what isÖ this?
Turn around.
Itís moon dust.

As a child I drank moon dew.
Bullets have no power over me.
So Iíve seen.

Lower your left arm.
The pain will pass into the earth.
Where do you come from?

Galicia. Last night
we crossed over the Carpathians.

Theyíre covered with snow. Here,
on the Tisza, thereís still summer.
Everything will pass.
Where are you?
Where are you?
Where are you?

You keep wandering around the world.
Youíve forgotten us.
Rusalina! Wake up, you little fool!
Zobar is here with presents for you.
Luiku.
Do you think Iíve gotten pretty?
Pretty as death.
And our mama, was she beautiful?

She was so beautiful that the women
chased her from the villages.

Whenever they saw her,
they made the sign of the cross.

There was no other Gypsy
that could compare to her beauty.

- Then Iím beautiful, too.
- How do you know?
Everyone always says,

Rusalina's the picture
of her mother.
Iíll find a master painter.

Youíll be the model for a portrait
of our mother in miniature.
Greetings, father.

People say that you have
acquired great knowledge.

They say you know Russian,
as well as German,

Polish,
and Rumanian, too?

Thatís right, father.
Thatís true.
And I only knowÖ
how to read menís faces.
Do you think thatís easier?
Not at all, father.

To read menís hearts as you do
is worth far more than books.

On your face
I see the shadow of death.
Send it away.
I only wish I could.

How many horses
have died under you?
Three.

I gave up after the second one,
and so should you.
No, father, I canít. I canít.

Yulishka, how do you manage
never to spill a drop?
I know by hearing where things are.

As I know youíre coming
by your horseís hoof beats.
I drink to you.
And I drink to you.

Donít misunderstand me, my friends,
when I come to this house

it is with respect
and affection for you.

You just squander your money,
you rascal.
Your eyes are shining as at a feast.

Aralambi,
turn your back to us, dear.
Face the wall.
Play a lullaby for us.

Yulishkaís eyelids are already
heavy with the evening mists.
You got no shame, Luiku.
You should know

that what is sweet
is always shameless.
I am your wheat field, Zobar,

whose grain you come to harvest
once a year
and leave again.

Are you all right?
You have a fever. Are you ill?
No.
Iíll bring you some fresh water.
Buy cocks, my beauty.
Youíre asking too much for them.

A Swiss watch, Mister Gypsy,
you wonít find one like it.
Listen to that sound!
Sweet-smelling hay!
Havenít you looked enough?
Beautiful Swiss watches!
Everything for you, Madame.
Or maybe for your gentleman?

Fine Swiss watches!
Fine Swiss watches!

Get your fresh sweet loaf!
Fresh sweet loaf!
Get him away, he eats my hay!
Do me now.
Me, too.
Ah, Shukar, that is lovely!

I can do everything,
but that beats me!
Iím selling it cheap.
Hereís a black beauty!

This is a young, healthy animal!
Buy a young black horse!
He is not young.
Just look at his teeth.

- When will you pay your debt?
- Youíll get it!
Come, my treasure,

come, my lovely, I will tell you
what your future holds.

- A handsome horse.
- An Arabian race horse.
Yeah, I see.

Do you remember last year, the horse
I bought from you in Mishkolts?

- From me?
- Yes.
Stand still!

You died this hack with ink,
bastard! Here, look!

Iíve looked for you
for a whole year, you dog!
Come on, come here.
Come, come here.
Iíll kill him!

Ah, Gypsies, why should we kill each
other? There arenít many of us left.
All right, calm down, everybody!
Take off that sheepskin!
If I do, Iíll be cold.

You must clean up our town
and throw out all this riff-raff!

Allow us, Officer,
and weíll drive him out...

You canít take
the law into your hands!

Heís also a human being, ladies and
gentlemen! He almost bought a watch.

Why, thereís the chicken
I thought Iíd lost!

I would have him whipped here now.
Donít you think Iím right, dear?
Of course you are, dear.

Iíd give you a gold piece
if youíll let him go.

Donít try to sweet-talk to me.
Iím doing my job.
This one should be whipped too.
Theyíre all the same.

Who wants to try
giving me the stick?
You?

Your Honour, if weíre not supposed
to steal chickens

or steal geese
or a loaf of bread,
how are we to live in this world?

Get out of here!
I donít want to see you anymore!

Youíll never see me again.
Iíll never forget your kindness.
Where are you from?

We came from Galicia.
We just got here.
Iím very grateful to you.

Donít steal anymore
chickens or geese.

- What should I steal?
- Girls.
And horses.

And if you canít steal, work.
You dishonour our people.

Would anyone hire me to work,
with a mug like this?

- Whatís your name?
- Bucha.

- Who is your headman?
- Old Nur.
Nemcho Nur?
Yeah, he canít seem to die.
And who are you?
Zobar.
Can you remember?
Luiku Zobar?

May you live
for all eternity!
Let all your wishes be granted!

What a fortunate man I am
to meet Zobar at last!
Where have you come from?

Come and visit us,
it would give us all such pleasure.

Our camp is not very far,
on the banks of the Tisza.

Youíll like our tribe, theyíre
the bravest.
Only I am a rotten apple.
For you.
From my heart.

Our girls are
as lovely as icons.

Get out of the way,
you spawn of the devil!
Turn back!
Letís turn!
Go on!
Youíre an extraordinary girl!
Good day to you, young ladies.
You look like a smart man, sir.
Only your driverís a fool.
May I apologize for us both?

Hereís my hand. Iíd like you
to tell my fortune if you will.

If you wish,
I can tell your name.
What is it?
I see it all here, my Lord.
Antal is your name.

Youíll have a long life, my Lord,
only I must tell you something.
Your life will be a miserable one,

because the devil of desire
dominates you,
but you're made of wax.
Have you nothing good to tell me?

Tell your driver to give me his whip
and Iíll drive for you.

Didnít I tell you, my Lord,
that youíve got a lot of wax in you?
Apolodor, give her the whip.

- Wait at the inn.
- Yes, sir.
Well, ladies, go into the coach.
All right, get in.
Letís ride!

Come and live in my house,
Iíll give you everything you want.
And have to bow to all your wishes?
Youíd better get lost, my Lord!
Giddap, darlings!

Oh, good afternoon,
my Lord.

Weíve just received the most
fabulous models from Paris.

The latest thing in fashion.
Please come right in.

Let me show you,
my Lord.

Look, my friends,
our honoured guest has arrived!

The day we welcome you,
is the greatest day for us all.

Your eyes are
like wells emitting light.
Out tribe has grown strong.
Chudra is back with us.

We also have Danilo,
a great soldier.

He bears scars that show
how bravely he fought.

He brought with him
his daughter, Rada.
And the sky above our camp
has become brighter than before.

Speak to us, Zobar,
words from your heart.

When you are gone,
your words will stay with us.

Stay away from her, Brother Luiku,
sheíd be the ruin of you.

And nobody will be able
to help you, not even me.
Beware, Zobar, sheís a witch.

- Donít you remember me?
- No.

You were in the forest,
your hair was in braids.
No.

You healed me with moon dust,
remember?
Giddap! Go on!

Rada, Iím made of granite,
like the mountain.

- Good.
- What's good?

Your words are good,
but your lies are bad.
What an old jade youíve got!

Iíll bring you
a beautiful white mare,
as fiery and wild as you are.

Iím going to be your destruction,
my friend. Your destruction.

I want that white mare.
You can have the rest.

Youíre lost, Zobar, youíre in her
power, that beautiful witch.
Oh, my pretty sweethearts!
Where is Zobar?

Whereís Luiku Zobar? Weíll find him
anyway, and weíll hang him.
But that will be tomorrow.

And today any one of you
can make money on him.
You hear me, Gypsies?

One hundred gold pieces for him
alive and fifty for his body!
Donít touch His Majesty

the Emperor
Franz Joseph the Second.

Please, Your Honour,
donít take him from me.

Where is Luiku Zobar?
Where is Zobar?

You donít know
where Zobar is either?

Weíll shoot every last one
of your horses and bears!

Where is Luiku Zobar? You hear,
Gypsies? A hundred pieces of gold!
Donít touch the wheels!

May you burn in hell
together with these wheels!

Donít touch them, I said!
Get out of here!

You just wait! Iíll show you
what a Gypsy can do!

So youíve got claws,
you stray cat!

Your Honour, donít touch
the Emperor Franz Joseph II!

General,
Iím at your service, sir!
Get out of here!
What are you laughing at, you fool?

Iím not a fool,
I am Zobarís sister.

You're the fool
to look in the trunk.

My name is Rusalina.
Iíll see that you remember me.
Whereís your brother?

You know what, policeman?
Iím gonna steal horses too.

- Weíll catch you and hang you.
- No way.

- Why not?
- We have drunk the moon dew.
Bullets canít stop us,

the forest gives us shelter,
the night saves us.

Sergeant,
Iíve found Napoleon!

Look, Sergeant,
Iíve found Napoleon!
ReadyÖ aim!

Donít shoot, please, Sergeant,
you must not do this!
Donít shoot!

Donít shoot!
Iíll give you my son.
Iíll give you Luiku Zobar.
Why did they do that?
We came too late. Theyíre gone.
Who are they?
Are they crazy or what?
No, brother, theyíre artistes.

I asked around.
The camp left two days ago.

They were seen heading for
the mountains.

They seemed to be
going back to Galicia.
All right.
Youíll go for nothing.
Go to Balint.

The money he owes me for
the Bessarabian racers is yours.

Why are you giving everything away
as if you were dying?
Share it with Bubulia.

Oh, Iím going to collect everything,
donít worry.
I donít want it, Zobar.

Iím going to GaliÒia with you,
all right?
No, brother Bubulia.
Go and find my people.
Give this to my sister.
Take it, brother Bubulia.
I give it to you.
Letís drink to our farewell.

What is this, brother?
Are you going to die?

Goodbye. When you get enough
of loving, youíll come back.
Go now. Go.
My sonÖ
Forgive me.

- Are you Luiku Zobar?
- Yes.

Youíre under arrest.
Put your hands on your head.
Stand up.
Just a second, you havenít paid.

All right,
you can keep my horse till I return.
Good enough.

Offer my respects to the young lady
and give her the dress.
Yes, sir.
A gift for you from my master.
Get up please, my dear.
Come on, rise!

Will you give me your daughter,
Danilo?

Iíll pay. Iíll give you whatever you
want.

Only rich men buy
and sell everything,
from pigs to their own souls.
You insolent nobody!

Why do you have dealings with
a nobody like me, your honour?

Iím sorry, soldier, I didnít mean
to offend you or your daughter.
Old habits die hard.

I came to you, Gypsy,
with my respect. And you?
Whereís your generosity, soldier?

I have no generosity, my Lord,
I have nothing.
I have only my daughter, Rada.
Nothing else!

Listen to me, my Lord,
I do have a favour to ask you.
Whatever you want.
Anything?

- Anything.
- You swear?
I swear.
I want Bucha to put on the dress.
Go on, Bucha, put it on!
Iím sorry, my Lord.
Come to my house tomorrow.
I invite you all. We will talk.

Here, soldier. It will come handy.
My name is Antal Siladi.
Bucha, go return his money.
Quickly!
Why?
Get out of my sight!
Excuse me for my audacity, my Lord.
You seem to be a kind and good man.

Donít come here again,
stay away from these people.

You can see that they only
know how to speak with knives.

My son, Almighty God
has commanded us
to work for the salvation of souls.

But it is not here on earth that
the sinner may find his redemption.

Youíve eaten the bread of the outlaw
and drunk the wine of stealing.

Do you know, Father,
how delicious stolen wine tastes?
Who are you?
A devil or simply a foolish child?
I am Zobar.

The greatest horse thief
in the world, Father.

Is there anything more youíd like
to say?

I wish I could bid farewell
to my people.

Stroke my horses and spit on them
to protect myself from the evil eye.

I wish I had a little
of that stolen wine to drink.

May God in heaven
save his soul.
And the body too, Father.
Pray to the Lord to save me

and I'll bring you
the best horse in the world.

- Shall I open up?
- Yes, do it.
Greetings, brother Balint!

Iíve come to get the money
you owe us, sir.
If youíll forgive my intrusion.
That I owe you?
Thatís right, your honour.

An old debt,
brother Balint, very old.

Youíre no brother to me,
remember it.
Donít get angry.

Zobarís gone away
and he sent me for the money.

I was not dealing with you, and
Iím not going to settle it with you.
Why are you so rude, brother Balint?

You shouldíve asked me into your
house, offered me some wine.
Itís no time to be drinking wine.
You know, brother Balint,

unless you pay up,
Iíll take the horses back.

I can easily sell them to Rumanians
or Guzuls across the river.

Perhaps you can even lose some
of your own. Thatís the man I am.
Go on, take them.
Oh, what a mistake, my Lord!
There they are, my darlings.

One, two, three,
four, five, six.
There you are, my sweethearts!

Iím gonna get married now,
with a dowry like this.
My lovelies!
Letís go home.
There you areÖ
Come alongÖ
What are you doing, sons of aÖ

Keep him hidden, and tonight
throw him in the Tisza.
Arenít you glad to see me?
Good day, Gypsies.

An honoured guest is always
welcome here.
Welcome, my Lord.
Good people!
I speak to you as to my peers.

My conscience is clear
before God and you.
Let Rada marry me.

Iíll share all with you, everything
I own!
Iím very rich, Danilo.

Why donít you say something,
old men?
Speak, daughter, whatís your answer?
Heís waiting!
Youíre welcome, my Lord.
Think about it, my Lord.

Your nest is for
doves and birds of prey.

What will I be
if I enter your nest?
Iíve given it a lot of thought,

before I came here
for the third time.

It would be better
if you didnít come.
I wish you a long and happy life.

- Where are you going?
- To the end of the world, my Lord.

- Why?
- To go there and come back.

What kind of people are you?
What do you want?

Nothing, my Lord.
Nothing but the road.
Letís go!

Donít take it too hard, my Lord.
Time will heal all.
May you burn in hell!
Let the devilís fires

spoil your beauty
and your life!
Burn in hell!
Pardon this sinner, heavenly Father.

I wish we had the drummers here,
in gold doublets, as in olden times.
I recall a hanging in Magdeburg.

That was a real spectacle!
It was unforgettable!
Almost like a coronation.

We canít begin to compare to it.
What weíre doing is vulgar!
Weíre in the provinces, gentlemen.

They donít even know
how to strangle a man here.
They write anonymous letters
full of errors in every line.

The local beauties here smear
goose fat over their hair.

Mister Mayor,
shall we read the sentence?
To whom? Itís just a waste of time.

Itís not Copernicus,
itís only a miserable horse thief.
Let me through!

Mister Mayor,
please pardon him!
I beg you, Mister Mayor!

- Take her away!
- Have pity!
No! No!

Please, have mercy!
Pardon him!

Guards, forward march!
One, two!
One two, one two! Left face!
Halt!
Stop sneezing, you idiot!

Of course, Mister Mayor!
I promise.
Mercenary dogs!

Mister Mayor,
I did it for you,

because he annoyed you
with his sneezing.

Tell them to release me
and Iíll do everything myself.
All right.
Step back!
Step back!
Iím waiting for your orders.

- Just get it over with quickly!
- Yes, sir.
Come on, my dear, get on with it.
Want some soap?
It makes it slide easier.
Save it for yourself.
Look, Mister Mayor.
What is he doing there?
I donít know, Mister Mayor.

- How did it get here?
- Itís very odd.
Get rid of it!
Yes, sir.
Get rid of that horse.

Shoot!
Donít stand there!
Bubulia, this way!
You fat pigs!
You eat too much!
It spoils your aim!
Thank you, heavenly Father!
Save my sinful soul.
Bubulia!
BubuliaÖ
Zobar!
Break it, Chudra.
I brought you
the white mare!
Zobar!

Look, Zobar, the cards always
say the same thing.
There were four of us.

It was as if we held the whole
earth in our hands.

Two of us were killed.
Talimon has vanished into thin air.
Now itís my turn.
WellÖ

You see?
Iím always wherever you are.

This is your road
and there you are,

and I am always
crossing your path.
Thatís a fine pipe you have.

A Polish prince gave it to me.
I was like gold, he said.

Yes, you all are. Ready to cut
each otherís throats for gold.

Two of your tribe
have come over to ours.

So your good-for-nothings
have got two more.

Or maybe itís
because Iím really like gold?
Oh, you really love yourself.
Who should I love then, Zobar?

What man will make
my heart vibrate
like a fine steel blade?
Hey, stop smoking.
But why?

There are saints here. You shouldnít
smoke in their presence.
What made them saints?
They suffered a lot.
All their lives, understand?
I suffer too.
I canít tell you how much I suffer.
So that makes me a saint too.

Zobar, why donít you build a fire
so I can dry my clothes?

Donít look at me that way,
Zobar. Donít look.
It will make your head spin.
Iíve never loved anybody.
But I love you.
And I love liberty, Luiku.
I love it more than you.
But you couldnít live without me,
as I couldnít live without you.
Will you be my body and soul, Luiku?

Your words are like clever snares,
Rada.
Theyíre spread out all around me.

Wherever I set my foot,
Iím bound to be caught.

But what would happen
should I escape your net, Rada?
Perhaps youíre blind, Zobar?
The earth is covered in nets.
Everybody sets up nets.

Some are subtle and honest,
others crude and brutal.
No one can avoid them.

Ah, Iíll offer you my lips
and my caresses, Zobar.

Ah, my love will be
so sweet.
Youíll forget the whole world.

You wonít miss those wild
gallops over the plain.

Tomorrow you will submit to me
like to your elder.

Youíll bow down before me
in front of my people.
And youíll kiss my right hand.
When you do, Iíll become your wife.
And thenÖ
Then weíll have our night.

I will come to you,
naked as a newborn child.

And we shall be reborn together,
Luiku.
Come here.

May your love lie heavy
upon your thoughts,

and upon your heart
and on the hands that caress me.
Drink!

Donít be afraid of me,
Luiku, donít.

I wasÖ I was even more
beautiful than your Rada.
Where is she? Whereís Rada?

Your Radaís gone away,
she left, my dear.
They set out at sunrise.

- Why have you stayed?
- Iíll wait for the first frost.

I must gather herbs,
then Iíll join them.

Just before winter kills herbs,
their poison is strongest.

- Where did they go?
- Toward the mountain pass.

Theyíll stop in Bucovina
and make camp.
VanityÖ
Itís all vanity.
And your suffering is vain, too.

Iíll give you a potion,
it will make you stronger.

And youíll forget
your love for Rada.
Ah, ZobarÖ
Youíll go there for your death.
What will you have?

Nothing.
Iíll rest a little, then Iíll go.

Go on, rest if you like.
Everyone only wants to rest today.
That cursed Friday.
Whatís the matter, Zobar?
Why do you look so sad?
Go wash up.
Wake up, man!

Hey, Innkeeper,
fill up four big jugs

with wine and hang them
on my saddle.
Right away, Zobar.
Today weíre going to celebrate!
Drink, my friends!

Take me to her.
Youíll be my best man.
Youíve forgotten.

I told you to have
three locks on you.

One for your lips, one for your
heart, and one for your thoughts.
Theyíve all been broken.
Take me to her.

I know, Zobar, youíve broken
many a wild horse,

only so far theyíve always
been easy ones.
Thatís so.
You are right.

Listen, Danilo,
a wild horse needs a strong hand.

Will you give me your daughter
in marriage?
Take her, Zobar, if you can.
No one can escape his destiny.
The fastest horse in the world

cannot help you
run away from yourself.
I take you for my wife, Rada,

upon my honour,
before your father,

before all our Gypsy
brothers and sisters.

He got a bridle on her!
Heís got her! What a man he is!

- Youíre an idiot!
- Why do you say that?

Weíll see
whoís got a bridle on whom.

I warn you, Rada,
donít go against my will.
Remember, I was born free
and I will go on living as I will.
Oh, Zobar!

What did you do that for?
It isnít funny, is it?
I think youíre safer on horseback.
Yes, I think youíre right.

What are you doing that for, girl?
Heís my best friend!

- Please help meÖ
- Get away!

Last night, brothers,
I looked
into my heart.

And I discovered that the old free
life no longer matters to me.
Only Rada matters.
Only she is in my heart.

And so I have decided,
brother Gypsies,
to bow down in front of her,

as she asked me to, to show everyone
that her beautyís conquered Zobar.

I who until now went to any woman
as a stallion goes to a mare.
Ah, Zobar, ZobarÖ
No, donít go, Chudra.

Stay and watch how Zobar
bows before your Rada.

What a long speech youíre making,
Zobar.

Never mind.
Donít be in a hurry.
Now witness thisÖ brothers.
Your hand.
Your hand!

No, Zobar,
you must bow down before me

and kiss my right hand,
as you promised.
Your hand.
No.
Zobar!
MamaÖ
MamaÖ
I knew thatÖ
Danilo!
Danilo!
RadaÖ
I didnít want toÖ
The End

title: Табор уходит в небо / Gypsies Are Found Near Heaven
